abilities.name: EDICT
abilities.description: When you win a combat, place 1 command token from your opponent's reinforcements in your fleet pool if it does not already contain 1 of that player's tokens; other player's tokens in your fleet pool increase your fleet limit but cannot be redistributed.

abilities.name: IMPERIA
abilities.description: While another player's command token is in your fleet pool, you can use the ability of that player's commander, if it is unlocked.

abilities.name: HUBRIS
abilities.description: During setup, purge your "Alliance" promissory note. Other players cannot give you their 'Alliance" promissory note.

flagship.name: Arvicon Rex
abilities: During combat against an opponent whose command token is not in your fleet pool, apply +2 to the results of this unit's combat rolls

mech.name: Starlancer
abilities: After a player whose command token is in your fleet pool activates this system, you may spend their token from your fleet pool to end their turn; they gain that token.

base.name: Scepter of Dominion
base.effect: At the start of the strategy phase: Choose 1 non-home system that contains your units; each other player who has a token on the Mahact player's command sheet places a token from their reinforcements in that system. Then, return this card to the Mahact player.
base.returnCondition: Then, return this card to the Mahact player.

base.name: Jae Mir Kan
base.ability: When you would spend a command token during the secondary ability of a strategic action: You may exhaust this card to remove 1 of the active player's command tokens from the board and use it instead.

base.name: Il Na Viroset
base.unlockCondition: Have 2 other factions' command tokens in your fleet pool
base.ability: During your tactical actions, you can activate systems that contain your command tokens. If you do, return both command tokens to your reinforcements and end your turn.

base.name: Airo Shir Aur
base.ability: ACTION: Move all units in the space area of any system to an adjacent system that contains a different player's ships. Space combat is resolved in that system; neither player can retreat or resolve abilities that would move their ships. Then, purge this card.
